TopicTitle: CKAN (The Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network); v1.28.0 - Dyson

Articles.Content:
3 minutes ago, Tyko said:

It looks like the only answers are to try to update - which doesn't work or download and reinstall CKAN? 

Correct. Get the new version from https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/releases/tag/v1.24.0

3 minutes ago, Tyko said:

if I download and reinstall won't all of my existing mods be reported as AD and not be upgradeable

No.

3 minutes ago, Tyko said:

or is there a way to avoid that?

Don't delete KSP or the CKAN folder.

3 minutes ago, HebaruSan said:

Correct. Get the new version from https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/releases/tag/v1.24.0

No.

Don't delete KSP or the CKAN folder.

Thanks for your help!

3 hours ago, Teoras said:

e: also the new version doesn't work, unless I'm not installing it properly or something. Would be good if there were more instructions than 'oh and btw versions prior x don't work :))))'

Click Continue, then Refresh.

3 hours ago, Teoras said:

e2: also would be good if there was a proper download file instead of 5 different files. Like, which one do I even choose to download? Do I need all of them? Do I install the earlier version first and then do the other one on top?

".deb" is for Debian-derived Linux distributions. If you don't use one of those, then ignore those files.

".dmg" is for MacOSX. If you don't use that, then ignore that file.

The notes say:

Quote
  • You don't need to download AutoUpdate.exe. This is used internally by CKAN when a new version is released.

Hopefully that's clear.

If you're on Windows, one file remains by process of elimination.

I'm not sure if I've done something wrong here, but I'm encountering a tenacious issue.

Every time I open CKAN I get this error message. 

It also comes up if I try to refresh the mod list.  I was running a somewhat old version of CKAN (I had turned off auto-update for some reason) so I decided to get the latest one.  I deleted the old .exe, installed the new one, and... the error message still comes up upon opening.

I put the whole error message here:

Spoiler

just-in-time (JIT) debugging instead of this dialog box.

EDIT:
Huh... well, for whatever reason it appears to have fixed itself.  I'm able to start it up and even refresh now.  Weird.

It downloaded all the mods, and it starts to install them, but after this crash, they disappear from GameData.   I'll just install them manually then, but, any suggestions?

    <system.windows.forms jitDebugging="true" />
</configuration>

When JIT debugging is enabled, any unhandled exception
will be sent to the JIT debugger registered on the computer
rather than be handled by this dialog box.

 

 

We've had one report of a similar error so far:  https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/issues/2342

No indication yet of the cause, but you can try manually creating the folder that it complains about (C:\Users\Thad\AppData\Local\Temp\CdFileMgr).

That's supposed to be created by the Transactions library that CKAN uses, but apparently that can fail for unknown reasons. Maybe something with permissions, maybe a malware blocker, not enough info to say yet.
@HebaruSan  Ah, sorry for being annoying.  And thank you for directing me to the answer.

FYI if you have the Crossover app for Mac, and use the exe file from this, it works as intended and great. Just put the CKAN exe in the KSP folder. 

 

On the bottle for CKAN, you have to be sure to install Windows Netframework 4.5 and above to ensure it works correctly. (Use a Windows 7 Bottle 64bit. Windows 10 has 4.5 built in and will not work with Ckan Very well)

 

This works for the KSP 1.4 for Mac.

26 minutes ago, Gargamel said:

Even after creating the folder previously, I added 2 new mods today, and it threw this error again.  Manually adding the folder fixed it, again.  Adding and removing previously cached/installed mods did not trigger this error. 

Have you tried to change read/write permisson over KSP folder and all subfolder ? To set read/write permission for all users on machine. You should do that only on KSP game folder, not for entire drive or other folders out of KSP, though.
